comments.author: Scott Haltizer

comments.author: Daniel Antil
comments.text: Yes, it's totally free.  Yes, they offer a wide selection of recent movies and TV shows (nothing newer than a few years old).  But, the commercial and pop-up ad interruptions can be annoying.  Multiple commercial breaks at random... Not like television - often interrupting in mid scene... Always the same 30 second commercial which you can't skip through... Followed by a pop-up ad, which you can skip through, but if you do, it shows up more often.  Then, you have to click on the movie for it to resume... When it does the picture is fuzzy until it takes time to adjust.  It's a very distracting way to watch a movie or show... But, if you can tolerate the interruptions, it's worth using.  The other drawback for me is the absence of a menu... You can't look up or search for a movie or show, you have to rely on skimming through the selections to find what you want... which is okay, but less convenient.   Full Review

comments.text: Wonderfully useful for an amateur astronomy buff. I downloaded the companion app as well if I needed Long/Lat conversion. My kids got ridiculously excited when an alarm chimed with new suggestion.   We looked for Shadow Bands. Saw none. We did see the crescent shaped shadows on our shelter from dappled sunlight shining through a tree. I don't recall hearing a cue about that. I might've missed it. If it doesn't exist in the current build, maybe add it?  Totally worth the $2. Looking forward to 2024 edition.   Full Review

comments.author: Ian Sutcliffe
comments.text: This version is an edited port of the handheld version of the game.  There are two extra characters and several extra battles not included in the original PS1 version.  Lots of new cutscene content and much improved translations.  This version doesn't have the multiplayer/rendezvous content, though.  It's a near-perfect game, but the game force closes on occasion, so make sure to save after every battle.  Also, make sure that you always have your battery charged/charging.  I got to the end of the 4th Chapter and my battery died during one battle.  When I recharged it and opened the game again, all my saved games were erased.  If I'm going to sit through the whole game again, it won't be with this version.   Full Review

After delving deeper into what I actually had I realized there is no option for multiplayer, which would really make this a lot more fun.  Then I realized there is an additional board you can buy (the classic board game), but the price is out of this world! Still a fun free game, but there's no chance of me ever spending that kind of money on additional characters and a board.   Full Review

One tip, give yourself time to learn the app. It takes some practice. Don't buy the app the same day as your draft. I also found that it was easier to practice on a tablet before using the app on my phone. Although the functions are the same for both devices it takes a little time to find them on a phone. The controls are clunky and a little difficult to get used to. The space battles are atrocious and primarily the reason I don't want to play it. I don't like the character models to choose from, either. Overall, great disappointment.   Full Review

comments.author: Matthew Krohn
comments.text: Transitions are slow and often freeze the game for a second or two, combat is bogged down by terrible character animations, skill system is restrictive and there is no portrait mode. Each on their own would be no issue but together makes the game nearly unplayable, which is rather depressing because I loved the previous two games.   Full Review

comments.author: Chris Coslor

comments.text: Update: After the patch the game is loading and work but the control are not responsive and everything takes too long to load.  Doesn't work on Samsung galaxy tab s3. comments.author: Pyotr Raphael
comments.text: Beautiful game. Everything, from the rpg mechanics, the quests, the storyline, EVERYTHING just begs to be explored! There are some performance issues which I'm sure the team will be addressing but man, right now, this is scratching that scifi rpg itch perfectly. I have beheld awesomeness, Behold Studios. EDIT: I've played a bit of it now and I think the thing I dislike the most about this game is the jarring shift to 3d in the space battles and the map. I like the idea of space battles, I just feel that maybe some of the characters could gain skills you can use during space battles. The 3d graphics also feel very forced. I was expecting an intensely colorful pixel map of space and I wanted to see how you guys would pull that off. I really hope you can change everything 3d back to pixel art. Everything else is great though, I love the battles and how the limited skill selections force you to properly think your way through a fight. It's just these blasted 3d graphics guys... ugh.   Full Review

comments.author: Noel Castellanos
comments.text: Absolutely loving the game. It saves my progress in the dungeon between my morning and afternoon commute. The controls are good, and take just a little bit of getting used to. My only con is that all the characters have the same "ouch" wound effect. Weird having a female character go "oof" lile the burly male one.  Buy it if you enjoy a challenge, collecting, dungeon crawling, and a pleasing gameplay experience that can be picked up anytime.   Full Review

comments.text: Game is bugged and doesn't work. Controls are totally broken. I can't navigate anywhere in the game and am stuck standing right where I am at the opening of the game. Reading the intro book given to me by the NPC, and sometimes I can exit the book, and sometimes I'm stuck in the book and can't do anything at all. Sometimes I can open the menu to try and adjust the settings, and other times the on-screen buttons don't do anything at all. Absolute waste of money.   Full Review

comments.author: Cullen Johnson
comments.text: It's an overall good port of a fantastic classic game, but there are a few small things that should be fixed, for instance, the screen will timeout if you're not touching it periodically. For a game where note-taking is essential, this is a bit annoying. Still, the old graphics and cinematics are stunning even today, and the strange and beautiful worlds of Riven are just as immersive on the small screen as they were on the computer!   Full Review

title: LEVEL-5 Inc. - Android Apps on Google Play
Laytonâs Mystery Journey - Android Apps on Google Play

comments.author: Kriza Belle Casem
comments.text: Fun game that's reminiscent of early Layton graphics. I've only finished up to Case 6, but the game so far plays more like a series of side quests rather than an overarching mystery that is gradually revealed. Overall, a fun game.  I do want to point out that the translation for one of the puzzles (so far) threw me off. I won't give too much away, but a better word for a puzzle involving math operations could be "solution" rather than "sum" since sum indicates addition.   Full Review

comments.author: Lee Gibson
comments.text: PSA: The early puzzle Failing Scales is poorly presented. The scales are not weighing the sugar incorrectly, and the lighter gray lines are not "lit up". It's just asking which two single-digit numbers would become different numbers that are one higher and one lower, respectively, if you remove the lower left section. (as opposed to becoming gibberish)   Full Review

comments.author: Isaac Gelman
comments.text: The art is beautiful and the game ran on my device flawlessly. Unfortunately there is no overarching mystery to keep me engaged and the "puzzles" were well below par. It shows after the passing of Akira Tago who was the puzzle designer on the previous games. Even the dozen little mysteries that make up the game are boring, shallow and obvious. It was a chore to finish.  If you're on the fence, skip this one. It's not important to the Professor Layton continuity.   Full Review

comments.author: Nora Buss
comments.text: It's a great game, but it erased all the items I'd transferred from the real-world puzzle solving site, that launched a month before the game itself. And now I can't get those items back. This happened after the app virtually reset itself - in the middle of my playing it. It's a good app, but that's a serious problem that I hope doesn't happen to anyone else.   Full Review

comments.author: Ben Kuiper
comments.text: Feels just like one of the classic Layton DS games. Overall, great fun and a density and craftsmanship that's uncommon in mobile games.   Yet, the writing and voice acting made me visibly wince on numerous occasions, and the Mysteries you solve were wicked predictable. Almost all of them were solving eye-rolling coincidences or miscommunications rather than true detective work. Likewise, the puzzles leaned heavily on the "Lateral Thinking" side, presenting you with a very intriguing and solvable puzzle as a woeful misdirect for an answer that was technically correct in the most aggravating way.  Gripes aside, highly recommend for fans of the Layton series and puzzles in general.   Full Review

comments.author: Troy Dolyniuk
comments.text: This scanner app works really well. My only complaint is that I must stop scanning after the first page to name my scan, and only after that can I add more pages clicking the button to add a page each time. I feel the workflow would be much smoother if once scanning began, assume there are multiple pages and scan them all, tap a button once to exit scanning mode, and then name the file.   Full Review

comments.author: Marty Charon
comments.text: I feel like I already reviewed this a long time ago, but it still works extremely well.  It's easy to use and the results are excellent and acceptable if you are trying to upload important documents to an institution or make records for yourself.  It automatically deskews the image, but remember to back off with your camera; if you fill the frame with a wide angle lens, the pincushion distortion is harder to fix.  Make the document centered and about 1/3 the size of the frame and auto-crop feature will restore the image to full size with minimal distortion.   Full Review

Some other player color options would be nice too. But I love this app and am very happy to have spent a dollar on it. A dollar is nothing compared to buying the actual board game.   Full Review

comments.author: Elizabeth Eddington
comments.text: Not rigged- I downloaded this last night. I'm not an "expert" Monopoly player but I do know how to play quite well. The game is supposed to be challenging, like a real game. I played it 6 times on medium and beat it every time. If it was actually rigged, that wouldn't happen. My only complaint is that the touch controls are way off during trades, building houses, and entering dollar amounts. I also wish there was a way to un-animate gameplay to make it faster.   Full Review

comments.author: Kate Bennett
comments.text: First off if this game would actually let me unmortgage property that would be a great start. Secondly the game doesn't fit my screen so the controls are hard to manage. Lastly the skill settings are highly inaccurate. On "easy" I sat in jail half of the game letting the computer character buy up property and land on community chest every other roll. Plus when I did pass go, I inevitably landed on income tax, over half of the time. Switched to medium and won. That makes no sense at all.   Full Review

comments.author: Stephen Perry
comments.text: Rigged Monopoly is a great game....unfortunately this app isn't. The AI is completely rigged. I owned an entire side of the board and the computer landed on chance three times in a row. Also the number of times you will land on the one property with a hotel is staggering. Keep in mind this is on very easy. This game will make you want to throw your phone through the wall. The odds of the computer being this "lucky" are astronomical small, and yet turn after turn and game after game, that is exactly what happens.   Full Review

comments.text: A great port with little disappointment . Amazing port of a classic game that I loved as a kid. Now I can play this legendary game without having to lug my heavy ass computer around. Thanks Chris Sawyer for bringing such a wonderful game to cell phone. My only complaint about this game is the lack of a scenario editor. I wanted to just make a big ass park with everything in it but because there is no scenario editor, I can't do that. A little disappointing . I now have to pick a scenario closest to what I want, which is limiting for me. 8.5 out of 10.   Full Review

comments.author: JM Richeson
comments.text: FL mobile is great!!! I have found FL mobile doesn't replace using FL Studio full version, but sometimes I'm not near my laptop and am not ready to open up my computer and get in to a fully committed project, this is where I value FL Mobile. If you already use FL Studio then there shouldn't be any real learning curve, not to suggest it operates exactly like FL Studio, but after using FL Studio than FL mobile is straight forward and makes logical since with little to no learning curve. It holds true to Image-lines the fastest way from your brain to your speakers. It loads MIDI clips, records playing, records vocals, automation. It has synths & FX. Use or create drum kits with provided wavs or your own wavs. Load wav audio clips. I've tested other mobile DAW type apps and FL mobile is by far the best on Android!!! Also I have used it to record vocals which I will save to my cloud and then open up in a project on FL Studio on my computer. I love it!!! Although I do not view it the same as FL Studio on my computer it is perfectly capable of creating full songs!!! Also if your phone allows you to cast then you can cast to your TV, if no headphones than it's better than phone speakers!! Put it this way you could record any sound anywhere at anytime and incorporate it into a project think of all the possibilities they're infinte!!!!   Full Review

I would however like to maybe suggest being able to add a Favorite recipe on one device, and then having that sync on any other device the app is installed on. They could be used to achieve diamonds without the need of boosts, in mosts cases, with said boosts easing the difficulty.  Now, without boosts, the best you'll see is a silver, gold if you try hard enough. NK is intent on selling their boost crates, Blop Magnets, and Supercharges, if not also the Blops themselves. comments.text: Not sure why folks are saying there's no search. There is, and I like that I can add my own custom foods, and they even show up in blue font so I know what's mine. I started using Cronometer to track my protein intake because I'm a vegetarian, and I really appreciate the level of detail it gives me about my macros. I got the app rather than continuing to use the free web interface because of the UPC scan feature. So helpful. Yes, the delete option is a little sensitive still, but at least you have to confirm before things get swiped away. Overall, it's been worth every penny.   Full Review

Add to this an extremely cumbersome manual adding process, and it becomes far too time consuming to use routinely. If that isn't enough, whatever the app uses to predict your food entry is awful. I take the same multivitamin every day, yet it's nowhere to be found on the list. Meanwhile, a random cheese I tried 2 months ago is still claiming the top spot. Great idea, but the execution is lacking.  Added back a star, because it does have way too many of the other features I'm looking for.   Full Review

The app does allow the assignment of labels to each food, but if you want to report on or otherwise use that information, there is no way to do that. The data just goes into a black hole. Hopefully my refund will be approved, otherwise I'm out $38 for a useless app. I guess I can't be mad at the developers out there offering FREE apps that are useless, but once you're charging this kind of money I just wonder how the "developer" is able to sleep at night. comments.text: Excellent weather radar app! I am an avid weather person...storm spotter and chaser. This is one of the no nonsense radar apps there is. I love it. Gives you fast radar with lightning and warning boxes. I have a lot of radar/wx apps...some I've paid over $10.00 for and this one is probably my favorite now. Only thing lacking is it does not offer an option to display watch boxes and edit warning box colors.   Full Review

comments.author: Rita Bowker
comments.text: This app is the best and only choice for quality weather monitoring. I have had this app on my iPhone, iPod touch, various Android devices and now  on my Nexus. You can toggle between base reflectivity or satellite cloud coverage overlays. You can view these over the map of your choosing, whether you want to just view your local area or a pull out and see the continent. You can choose a map to include city, state and streets, or just go to the hybrid view which is like overlaying real time weather over Google Earth. You can pause or play weather for a past period of time and even change the speed of the playback. Add weather tracks or even lightening strikes. Weather you are concerned citizen wanting to see what weather is coming your way, or a meteorologist attempting to identify possible hook rotation patterns, this is the app you want to use. I am highly pleased and highly recommend this app.   Full Review

comments.text: I only put 5 stars so people will see this. I keep getting an error message (5003) like A LOT of other people, especially with newer phones. It's free, you get to customize, the graphics are great, controls can be set to any of your liking and it's a game you can play every day without getting board. So long story short don't pay for this one, just get the free one.   Full Review

comments.author: Gawen Pinkett
comments.text: You can do better EA. Amazing, but not good enough. Hasn't had more content added since before I got it, months ago. Hate the auto acceleration, needs free roam and more cars. Could also use more customisation. This game has really great graphics etc and has the potential to become the best android car game, but without those features that the pc one DOES have, even though mobile isn't as good, it still needs them, it isn't. Especially needs manual acceleration.   Full Review

comments.author: Noah Gibbons
comments.text: Suggestions I love this game and play it often. I found that with the right strategy and learning how to drift effectively, you can reach 100% completion rather quickly. I have a couple suggestions and I know these are a lot to ask development wise  and also being that this is a moderately old game, so they aren't necessarily necessary but more things to consider. 1. A longer story mode with various difficulty levels 2. More profound vehicle customization (body kits, rims, more colours, permanent performance upgrades)   Full Review

comments.text: So fun so good so perfect Started with Where is my water 2 free game. The idea was exellent but attrocely bloated with ads, crashed all the times etc...This one is exellent. comments.author: drewfla
comments.text: This game has provided me with countless hours of fun.  It's unique, the artwork and animation are very well done, the physics are very accurate.  I could go on and on.  I purchased the game years ago on my Galaxy S3.  I later got an S4 and now have an S5, and I downloaded it to each phone and finished the game 100% each time.  It's a great game, very fun and challenging at times as well.  You can get stuck on a level for quite a while sometimes.  Definitely worth getting!  Also, here's a helpful tip: pay attention to the names of the levels.  They're often a hint on how to beat them!   Full Review

comments.author: Brandon Lowery
comments.text: Genuinely fun. I heard about this game when it came out, I looked it up and I really didn't think too much about it. So, I never downloaded it myself. Then my son decided he wanted to get it and he's too young to play it by himself so he kept asking me for help on the hard levels. Instantly I was hooked. Is is a cute puzzle game that is genuinely fun to play. I didn't think twice about spending the two bucks on it. I'm hooked and am glad that my son was adventurous enough to discover it.  10/10   Full Review

comments.text: Loved it! Simple to pick up but difficult to master. Very similar to games like Bejeweled and Candy crush but much more relaxing. Haven't been able to put it down since I bought it. comments.author: Danilo Aiello
comments.text: I'm still playing the normal mode, and I'm having fun. However there are two main points against this game:   1) It's not hard enough, though I hope the hard mode to be challenging.  2) The score system gives a malus of -100 for every move made during a game. This is too low! It should be at least -300, so that the highest scores in the world wouldn't be from people with plenty of time to lurk on a level, just avoiding to complete it increase the score!   Full Review
